TopicTitle: The OVC-150 Antares! Better late than never Edition!

Articles.Content:
Hello! I'm here today to present the results of 3 days of hard work!

The Antares Shuttle (Former Mock-up shuttle)

Now a little of behind scenes :

All i wanted was a entire shuttle launch system but at the moment i was only able to do the orbiter itself, it was hard but most of the hard work was on the cockpit where it was a R&D(D stands for destruction) for a nice front, i also got hurt on a finger by accident after using my "Manly silicon application" (Pressing the hot silicon so it covers the area much better). After that i discovered the best friend of a kerbal stability issue The Mighty Duct Tape Paper edition!, Sorry i had no struts .

Glorious Final Edit!- Hey there! Im back whit this little project I know i stopped posting about it but dont worry its finally done, Didn't Went as suppossed but here!.

Im so sorry from forgetting to show you guys a photo of the complete Antares shuttle but i didn't had time for that, Now im starting to do these things again, This time i'll do a Polikarpov I-153 "Chaika", but before i can do that i needed to post back here the last progress made for the OVC-150.

I hope you guys see the next thing i do at this because i want to make a Little I-153 and i want YOU GUYS to see it!

And also a thank for your support

Time for glorious Orbiter Photos!

Development photos here! -

Close Up

The best friend of a kerbal (After SRBs and struts)

Not So Technical Specs:

Structure made out of the next elements:

2 pairs of wings, Pasted together to resist

Kitchen paper tube cut by half, Used for the cargo bay and part of the Engine mount

3 Rocket engines, 2 small diameter and 1 Big diameter engine all painted the same

Nose cone Not included (At the moment)

A sheet of Shell paper for every structural part

Small Winglet A-Unused but now "Dev trophy"

Medium Winglet B-Mounted on the Antares Shuttle

LOTS OF PAPER TAPE!!!, Used over every unstable surface and junction made!

Black paint, Preliminary heat tile paint and Rocket engines bells

Grey paint, Apparently on part of the cargo bay and on the rocket engines.

Edited May 23, 2014 by Zaryulenko
35cm from the main SSME to the cockpit and 22.5cm from wings and 10.2 from bottom to top of the winglet, honestly i expected it to be the half of its size

It's a DIY Duct Tape Orbiter!

You said "Rocket engines", did you actually mean engines?!. Model rocket ones?

It's a DIY Duct Tape Orbiter!

You said "Rocket engines", did you actually mean engines?!. Model rocket ones?

Nope i actually wanted to say SSME but i forgot about them, they are made out of paper and yes a duct tape orbiter, Im sure jebediah would be proud of it!

I'm gonna make one.

What are the wings made of? Just normal styrofoam?

What are the wings made of? Just normal styrofoam?

two sheets of shell paper put together for extra resistance. I recommend you to be REAAAAAALLY careful at the cockpit, Its the most complex part of all (Just see the abuse of paper tape)

Any progress? I just made some sketches of my model (still too ugly for the internetz). It's gonna be about 40cm long, and it'll have a working cargo bay.

Are you going to add OMS engines to it?
Name it Desley. Or just the obvious Jebidiah. Myabe even krrim.

Any progress

Are you going to add OMS engines to it?

The small Rocket engines are the OMS, i call them the Multi-purpose Support Ascend-Maneuver Engines or OMS-CE90.

The im going to do the last step of work at this moment, im preparing a mix of glue and water for extra covers (For the nose but i decided to use it somewhere else like the bottom and the cargo bay to match the heights, no pics for the next 2 hours .
Well, It may be back from the dead but atleast its done, I needed to do this to continue to my next project!

Any new pics?

See the update on first post.
